intro: Otostegia integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf spurge, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant has simple, opposite, and often hairy leaves that are entire or slightly lobed. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. Otostegia integrifolia is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open woodlands.
